question.text:
Read the following statement about animal tissue. Identify the true and false ones and select the correct option.

I. Adhering junctions along with cementing cells together facilitate the cells to communicate with each other by connecting the plasma membranes of adjoining cells.
II. Compound epithelium covers the moist surface of the buccal cavity, pharynx and lining of ducts of salivary glands.
III. The striated muscle fibre is a thin elongated with point ends and multiple nuclei
IV. Cartilage is present in the tip of the nose and between the bodies of adjacent vertebrae.

options.text: I: False, II: True, III: False, IV: True
I: True, II: True, III: True, IV: False
I: False, II: False, III: True, IV: False
I: True, II: False, III: False, IV: True

solution.text:
I. Adhering junctions perform cementing to keep neighbouring cells together.
II. Compound epithelium covers the dry surface of the skin, the moist surface of the buccal cavity, pharynx, the inner lining of ducts of salivary glands, and of pancreatic ducts.
III. A striated muscle fibre is a thin elongated with blunt ends and multiple nuclei.
IV. Cartilage is present in the tip of the nose, outer ear joints, between adjacent bones of the vertebral column, limbs, and hands in adults.
